stories.title: Baseline no-op strategy implementation
steps: Step 1: Create strategy class inheriting from BaseStrategy
Step 2: Implement minimal required factory functions
Step 3: Add safe no-op on_data handlers (no order placement)
Step 4: Verify strategy can be imported and instantiated
Step 5: Run evaluation end-to-end with no trades
Step 6: Verify metrics report correctly with zero fills

stories.title: Basic market-maker quoting logic
steps: Step 1: Implement symmetric spread calculation around mid-price
Step 2: Add quote placement for YES and NO instruments
Step 3: Enforce price bounds [0.01, 0.99]
Step 4: Implement minimum quantity and notional checks
Step 5: Add quote cancellation on stale prices
Step 6: Test quote placement generates valid orders
Step 7: Verify quotes result in fills when effective BBO crosses
Step 8: Check PnL calculation after basic fills

stories.title: Complementary instrument awareness
steps: Step 1: Store YES/NO instrument pairs by slug
Step 2: Track complement BBO for each instrument
Step 3: Calculate implied BBO from complement prices
Step 4: Use max(direct, implied) for effective bid
Step 5: Use min(direct, implied) for effective ask
Step 6: Verify implied liquidity correctly computed
Step 7: Test quotes account for complement pricing

stories.title: Inventory-aware position management
steps: Step 1: Track net position per instrument from fills
Step 2: Track average cost basis for each position
Step 3: Implement position limit thresholds (long/short)
Step 4: Add inventory skew to quote pricing
Step 5: Widen spread as position approaches limits
Step 6: Stop quoting one side when at position limit
Step 7: Test position limits prevent runaway exposure
Step 8: Verify skew adjustments affect pricing correctly

stories.title: Spread calculation and calibration
steps: Step 1: Implement base spread as configurable parameter
Step 2: Add volatility estimate from recent price moves
Step 3: Scale spread with volatility metric
Step 4: Add adverse selection adjustment from orderflow
Step 5: Implement minimum spread floor
Step 6: Test spread adapts to market conditions
Step 7: Verify spread prevents excessive adverse fills

stories.title: Order lifecycle management
steps: Step 1: Track open orders per instrument
Step 2: Cancel stale orders on new market data
Step 3: Implement order timeout mechanism
Step 4: Replace orders when quotes need updating
Step 5: Handle partial fills correctly
Step 6: Log all order submissions and fills
Step 7: Verify no duplicate orders submitted
Step 8: Test order replacement is atomic

stories.title: Multi-instrument orchestration
steps: Step 1: Load all slugs from metadata
Step 2: Subscribe to quote/trade/depth for all instruments
Step 3: Maintain separate state per instrument pair
Step 4: Process updates for all active markets
Step 5: Balance CPU/memory across many instruments
Step 6: Test strategy runs on full slug list
Step 7: Verify no cross-contamination between markets
Step 8: Check all instruments receive quotes

stories.title: Depth-based liquidity assessment
steps: Step 1: Parse OrderBookDepth10 snapshots
Step 2: Sum available liquidity at each price level
Step 3: Calculate depth-weighted mid price
Step 4: Estimate fill probability from depth
Step 5: Adjust quote size based on available depth
Step 6: Test depth consumption estimates
Step 7: Verify quotes don't exceed available liquidity

stories.title: Order flow bucket signal extraction
steps: Step 1: Subscribe to OrderFlowBucketDepth10CustomData
Step 2: Parse add/cancel/trade counts per level
Step 3: Calculate net flow (adds - cancels) per side
Step 4: Detect aggressive vs passive flow patterns
Step 5: Adjust quotes based on flow imbalance
Step 6: Test flow signal improves quote placement
Step 7: Verify adverse selection reduction from flow

stories.title: Chainlink oracle integration
steps: Step 1: Subscribe to ChainlinkCustomData feed
Step 2: Store latest oracle price per asset
Step 3: Compute implied probabilities from oracle
Step 4: Compare market prices to oracle-implied fair
Step 5: Skew quotes toward oracle-implied value
Step 6: Test oracle integration doesn't break strategy
Step 7: Verify oracle prices used in decision logic

stories.title: Time-to-maturity adjustments
steps: Step 1: Parse start_date and end_date from metadata
Step 2: Calculate remaining time to settlement
Step 3: Widen spread as maturity approaches
Step 4: Reduce position limits near maturity
Step 5: Stop quoting in final minutes before settlement
Step 6: Test maturity logic triggers correctly
Step 7: Verify no trading after market closes

stories.title: Cross-pair minting arbitrage detection
steps: Step 1: Check if YES+NO prices sum to < 1.0
Step 2: Detect minting opportunities (buy both < $1)
Step 3: Check if YES+NO prices sum to > 1.0
Step 4: Detect burning opportunities (sell both > $1)
Step 5: Adjust quotes to prevent being arbed
Step 6: Test minting logic matches fill model
Step 7: Verify no losses from mint/burn misalignment

stories.title: Baseline evaluation run on all slugs
steps: Step 1: Run evaluate.py with baseline strategy
Step 2: Verify all 9 slugs complete successfully
Step 3: Record baseline PnL, volume, fill count
Step 4: Check for any exceptions or errors
Step 5: Verify output metrics format is correct
Step 6: Save results to benchmark file

stories.title: Smoke test with single slug
steps: Step 1: Modify evaluation to run one slug only
Step 2: Verify fast completion (<30 seconds)
Step 3: Check smoke test produces valid output
Step 4: Add smoke command to init.sh
Step 5: Document smoke test usage in RUNBOOK

stories.title: Metrics collection and reporting
steps: Step 1: Parse fill report DataFrame correctly
Step 2: Calculate realized PnL from fills to settlement
Step 3: Calculate total traded volume (qty * price)
Step 4: Count number of fills
Step 5: Add per-instrument breakdown metrics
Step 6: Generate summary statistics report
Step 7: Save metrics to JSON output file
Step 8: Verify metrics match manual calculations

stories.title: Regression testing framework
steps: Step 1: Save baseline metrics as reference
Step 2: Add script to compare new results vs baseline
Step 3: Flag significant metric degradations
Step 4: Add tolerance thresholds for regression
Step 5: Generate regression test report
Step 6: Document regression testing in RUNBOOK

stories.title: Performance profiling and optimization
steps: Step 1: Add timing instrumentation to strategy
Step 2: Measure time per data update handler
Step 3: Identify bottlenecks in hot paths
Step 4: Profile memory usage across instruments
Step 5: Optimize slow operations
Step 6: Verify optimization doesn't change results
Step 7: Document performance characteristics

stories.title: Fill model validation and diagnostics
steps: Step 1: Extract fill reasons from fill model logs
Step 2: Count fills by reason (eff_bbo, mint, cross, passive)
Step 3: Verify fill prices match expected levels
Step 4: Check no fills occur outside BBO bounds
Step 5: Validate complement-based fills are correct
Step 6: Test edge cases (0.01, 0.99 prices)
Step 7: Document fill model behavior
Step 8: Create fill model test suite

stories.title: Position limit enforcement
steps: Step 1: Define max position per instrument (e.g., 10,000)
Step 2: Check position before every order submission
Step 3: Reject orders that would exceed limits
Step 4: Log position limit rejections
Step 5: Test limits prevent excessive exposure
Step 6: Verify limits apply to open orders too

stories.title: Notional exposure tracking
steps: Step 1: Calculate notional exposure per instrument
Step 2: Sum total portfolio notional
Step 3: Set max portfolio notional limit
Step 4: Stop quoting when portfolio limit hit
Step 5: Test portfolio limit enforcement
Step 6: Report notional exposure in metrics

stories.title: Drawdown monitoring
steps: Step 1: Track running PnL during backtest
Step 2: Calculate peak equity level
Step 3: Compute current drawdown from peak
Step 4: Log maximum drawdown reached
Step 5: Add drawdown metrics to output
Step 6: Test drawdown calculation correctness

stories.title: Adverse selection detection
steps: Step 1: Track fills vs subsequent price moves
Step 2: Measure average adverse move post-fill
Step 3: Detect systematic adverse selection
Step 4: Widen spread when adverse selection high
Step 5: Log adverse selection metrics
Step 6: Test adverse selection improves over time

stories.title: Price precision and rounding safety
steps: Step 1: Verify all prices use 2 decimal precision
Step 2: Check no floating point rounding errors
Step 3: Test edge cases at 0.01 and 0.99 bounds
Step 4: Ensure complement prices sum correctly
Step 5: Validate quantity precision matches instrument
Step 6: Add assertions for price validity

stories.title: Order validity pre-submission checks
steps: Step 1: Check instrument exists before creating order
Step 2: Validate price within [0.01, 0.99]
Step 3: Validate quantity >= minimum
Step 4: Check notional >= minimum notional
Step 5: Verify no NaN or inf values
Step 6: Add comprehensive order validation function
Step 7: Log rejected invalid orders
Step 8: Test validation catches all edge cases

stories.title: Mid-price calculation methodology
steps: Step 1: Compare simple BBO mid vs depth-weighted mid
Step 2: Test micro-price (depth-weighted) accuracy
Step 3: Evaluate complement-aware mid calculation
Step 4: Measure mid-price prediction quality
Step 5: Choose best mid calculation for strategy
Step 6: Document mid-price methodology

stories.title: Optimal spread width tuning
steps: Step 1: Run strategy with spreads from 1bp to 10bp
Step 2: Measure PnL vs spread width
Step 3: Measure fill rate vs spread width
Step 4: Find optimal spread for PnL per fill
Step 5: Test spread stability across slugs
Step 6: Document spread tuning results
Step 7: Implement adaptive spread mechanism

stories.title: Quote size optimization
steps: Step 1: Test fixed size vs depth-proportional size
Step 2: Measure adverse selection vs quote size
Step 3: Test inventory turnover vs size
Step 4: Find optimal size for risk-adjusted returns
Step 5: Implement dynamic size adjustment
Step 6: Document size optimization findings

stories.title: Inventory skew parameter calibration
steps: Step 1: Test skew coefficients from 0.0 to 1.0
Step 2: Measure inventory mean reversion speed
Step 3: Measure PnL vs skew aggressiveness
Step 4: Find optimal skew for inventory control
Step 5: Test skew effectiveness across slugs
Step 6: Document skew calibration results

stories.title: Order flow signal effectiveness
steps: Step 1: Measure predictive power of add/cancel flow
Step 2: Test flow imbalance correlation with price
Step 3: Evaluate different flow aggregation windows
Step 4: Implement flow-based quote adjustment
Step 5: Measure PnL improvement from flow signals
Step 6: Document flow signal findings

stories.title: Market regime detection
steps: Step 1: Classify markets as trending vs mean-reverting
Step 2: Detect high vs low volatility regimes
Step 3: Identify liquidity dry-up periods
Step 4: Adjust strategy parameters per regime
Step 5: Test regime-aware strategy performance
Step 6: Document regime detection methodology

stories.title: Cross-market correlation analysis
steps: Step 1: Measure price correlations across slugs
Step 2: Identify co-moving market groups
Step 3: Test portfolio diversification benefit
Step 4: Implement correlation-aware sizing
Step 5: Measure risk reduction from diversification
Step 6: Document correlation findings

stories.title: Strategy parameter configuration system
steps: Step 1: Define strategy config dataclass/dict
Step 2: Pass config via --strategy-kwargs JSON
Step 3: Add parameter validation on init
Step 4: Document all configurable parameters
Step 5: Test parameter loading from JSON
Step 6: Add config to output metadata
Step 7: Create parameter sweep utility
Step 8: Document parameter tuning guide

stories.title: Logging and debugging infrastructure
steps: Step 1: Add structured logging with levels
Step 2: Log all key events (quotes, fills, cancels)
Step 3: Add debug mode with verbose output
Step 4: Create per-instrument log filtering
Step 5: Output logs to timestamped files
Step 6: Test log parsing and analysis
Step 7: Document logging configuration

stories.title: Backtesting result visualization
steps: Step 1: Create PnL time series plot
Step 2: Plot position over time per instrument
Step 3: Visualize spread and mid over time
Step 4: Generate fill distribution histograms
Step 5: Create risk metric dashboards
Step 6: Save plots to output directory
Step 7: Add plotting script to init.sh
Step 8: Document visualization usage

stories.title: Quote freshness and staleness detection
steps: Step 1: Track timestamp of last market data update
Step 2: Define staleness threshold (e.g., 5 seconds)
Step 3: Cancel all quotes when data goes stale
Step 4: Resume quoting when fresh data arrives
Step 5: Log staleness events
Step 6: Test staleness detection works correctly
Step 7: Verify no stale quote fills occur

stories.title: Quote price improvement logic
steps: Step 1: Check if our quote can improve BBO
Step 2: Place quote at best_bid + tick or best_ask - tick
Step 3: Ensure price improvement doesn't cross mid
Step 4: Test queue priority from improvement
Step 5: Measure fill rate improvement
Step 6: Document price improvement strategy

stories.title: Trade velocity monitoring
steps: Step 1: Track fills per minute per instrument
Step 2: Calculate rolling trade velocity
Step 3: Set maximum velocity threshold
Step 4: Pause quoting if velocity too high
Step 5: Log velocity limit events
Step 6: Test velocity control prevents over-trading

stories.title: Sharpe ratio and risk-adjusted returns
steps: Step 1: Calculate returns time series from PnL
Step 2: Compute return mean and standard deviation
Step 3: Calculate Sharpe ratio (annualized)
Step 4: Add Sharpe to metrics output
Step 5: Compare Sharpe across strategy variants
Step 6: Document risk-adjusted metric definitions

stories.title: Multi-level quote placement
steps: Step 1: Implement ladder of quotes at multiple levels
Step 2: Size quotes inversely with distance from mid
Step 3: Ensure total exposure stays within limits
Step 4: Test multi-level improves fill diversity
Step 5: Measure PnL improvement from laddering
Step 6: Document multi-level quote strategy

stories.title: Fill model passive vs aggressive analysis
steps: Step 1: Separate fills by reason type
Step 2: Compare PnL by fill type
Step 3: Measure adverse selection by type
Step 4: Identify most profitable fill paths
Step 5: Optimize quote placement for best fills
Step 6: Document fill type analysis findings

stories.title: Win rate and trade outcome analysis
steps: Step 1: Classify each fill as win/loss at settlement
Step 2: Calculate overall win rate percentage
Step 3: Compute average win size vs average loss size
Step 4: Analyze win rate by side (buy/sell)
Step 5: Add win rate metrics to output
Step 6: Document trade outcome methodology

stories.title: Emergency shutdown and risk controls
steps: Step 1: Add max loss threshold parameter
Step 2: Monitor cumulative loss during backtest
Step 3: Cancel all orders when loss limit hit
Step 4: Stop all quoting when shutdown triggered
Step 5: Log shutdown events clearly
Step 6: Test shutdown prevents further losses
Step 7: Add shutdown status to metrics output

stories.title: Comparative strategy benchmarking
steps: Step 1: Implement multiple strategy variants
Step 2: Run all variants on same slug set
Step 3: Compare PnL across variants
Step 4: Compare risk metrics across variants
Step 5: Generate comparative performance table
Step 6: Document best-performing variant
Step 7: Create strategy comparison script
Step 8: Add comparison to RUNBOOK

stories.title: Time-of-event analysis
steps: Step 1: Extract minute-of-market for each fill
Step 2: Analyze PnL by time within market duration
Step 3: Identify profitable vs unprofitable periods
Step 4: Test time-based quote adjustments
Step 5: Optimize strategy for early vs late periods
Step 6: Document time-of-event findings

stories.title: Data quality and coverage checks
steps: Step 1: Measure quote update frequency per slug
Step 2: Measure trade tick frequency per slug
Step 3: Measure depth snapshot frequency per slug
Step 4: Detect gaps or stale data periods
Step 5: Log data quality warnings
Step 6: Report coverage stats in metrics
Step 7: Document expected data frequencies

stories.title: Post-settlement P&L reconciliation
steps: Step 1: Retrieve settlement outcome per slug
Step 2: Mark positions to settlement price (0 or 1)
Step 3: Calculate realized P&L from all fills
Step 4: Verify P&L matches evaluation output
Step 5: Test P&L calculation on edge cases
Step 6: Add P&L breakdown per instrument
Step 7: Document P&L reconciliation process

stories.title: Continuous integration and automated testing
steps: Step 1: Add pytest test suite for utilities
Step 2: Add integration test for baseline strategy
Step 3: Set up CI pipeline (GitHub Actions)
Step 4: Run regression tests on every commit
Step 5: Add test coverage reporting
Step 6: Document testing procedures
Step 7: Add CI badge to README

stories.title: Strategy persistence and state management
steps: Step 1: Add checkpoint saving during long runs
Step 2: Implement strategy state serialization
Step 3: Add resume from checkpoint capability
Step 4: Test checkpoint/resume correctness
Step 5: Document checkpoint usage
Step 6: Add checkpoint interval parameter
